critique: The document is an executive order establishing civil service rules. It aims to regulate hiring and promotion within the federal government, emphasizing merit-based selection through examinations. It also seeks to prevent political interference in civil service appointments and protect employees from coercion. The document outlines different branches of the classified civil service (departmental, customs, and postal), specifies examination requirements for various positions, and establishes procedures for application, examination, and appointment. It also includes provisions for transfers, promotions, and reinstatements. The document emphasizes fairness and equal opportunity, prohibiting discrimination based on political or religious opinions. It also includes a preference for veterans. It seems to be expanding federal power by creating a more robust civil service. It is also slightly liberal by promoting social inclusion and preventing discrimination. It is also intervening in the economy by regulating hiring and promotion practices.
